submapp.map2d.Map2d.map_from_classes¶

Map2d.map_from_classes(classes: numpy.ndarray, true_values: numpy.ndarray = [], overwrite: bool = False) → None¶

Construct the Map2d from a vector of classes

Note

Missing values are represented by NaN and the class associated to an entire missing vector is -1

Parameters

  • classes (np.ndarray[int]) – Classes representing some real data

  • true_values (np.ndarray[float], optional) – Real values. Values represented by the Map2d. Defaults to []. In this case the true values are supposed unkown. In this case, the relative error relerr of the Map2d can’t be computed

  • overwrite (bool, optional) – Indicate whether the previous values ( values, true_values, classes, ) should be cleared. Defaults to False, in this case, the new values are appended to the current ones.

Return type

None

See also

map_from_data
